moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: Moves of the opening needed no commentary. Standard Sicilian formation has arisen. Now my opponent opted for f5 to make his light-squared bishop as active as possible.
moves.11. f5 e5 12. Nde2 Nb4 13. a3 Nc6: My 12th move proved as just a waste of tempo. I should have played Rc8 right away.
moves.14. h3 Rc8 15. g4 Na5 16. Bd5 Bc6 17. Qe: !, My opponent made a mistake allowing me to win control over c4 square. Probably 16. Ba2 was the right choice. Now he makes another inaccuracy with his remaining bishop.
moves.20. Bc1 Bg5 21. b3 Ne3 22. Bxe3 Bxe3+ 23: As a result of my opponents mistakes, I won material, and I have a strong attack on white king. Let's take a look on the following.
good pawn sac in order to open lines for attack
moves.29. Kxe4 Rc8c4+ 30. Rd4 Qe8+ 31. Kf3 h5: my attack is coming to it's end, but I have an extra pawn and I can force white into an ending that is lost for him.
This is an easily won position for black so  WHITE RESIGNS
